poem.title: By Land or Sea
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Griffin, there is a path - Wriggle to the middle of the lettuce, sleep - Under the tree, wrapped in vellum sketch maps, it Leads, you follow, wary. That angel clothed in the sun is just A boy, an oxherd. Learn from the ox To stray from pain when you need to, To stray from griffin. Watch for the drone that guards a hoard To spend in India, where every year is the first With a girl 3/4 black, 4/4 lovely. Thinking back, You might wonder at a ship that you once saw in the roads, The Finn MacCool.
